page.title: 18HANFORD NEAR SHROTON
page.content: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF HAMBLEDON HILL FROM SHROTON IS{HANFORD,}A PREPARATORY BOARDING SCHOOL OF ABOUT 170 GIRLS AND THERE ARE 15 TEACHERS. GIRLS COME HERE FROM ALL OVER ENGLAND AND OTHER PARTS OF THE WORLD WHEN THEY ARE EIGHT AND THEY ARE PREPARED FOR THE COMMON ENTRANCE EXAMINATION TO PUBLIC SCHOOLS WHICH THEY TAKE WHEN THEY ARE 13. THEY GO ON TO{SHERBORNE, CROFT HOUSE}AND OTHER MAJOR SCHOOLS. HANFORD IS A LARGE COMFORTABLE HOUSE WITH TALL CHIMNEYS BUILT IN{JAMES I'S REIGN.}THE GARDENS ARE KEPT VERY WELL AND THERE ARE TWO LOVELY BIG CEDAR TREES THAT HAVE BEEN THERE FOR HUNDREDS OF YEARS. NEXT TO THE SCHOOL IS{HANFORD FARM WHICH IS A DAIRY FARM ORGANISED TO SHOW SCHOOL PARTIES THE WHOLE PROCESS OF{MILK PRODUCTION,}FROM THE COWS FILING INTO THE MILKING PARLOUR TO THE MILK BEING STORED IN LARGE TANKS.
